item.title: Categorical products and coproducts
item.description: Universal property of coproducts Let $X_1, X_2$ be objects of the category $\vC$. The coproduct of $X_1$ and $X_2$ (if it exists) is a space $X_1 \coprod X_2$ and two morphisms $j_1 \from X_1 \to X_1 \coprod X_2$, $j_2 \from X_2 \to X_1 \coprod X_2$ such that the following diagram commutes (the first is with MathJax AMScd, the second is an embedded SVG produced with xypic): $\require{amscd}$ $$ \begin{CD} X_1 @>{j_1}» X_1 \coprod X_2 @<{j_2}« X_2 \\\ @| @VVhV @| \\\ X_1 @>{h_1}» Z @<{h_2}« X_2 \\\ \end{CD} $$
